title: Next.js Documentation - Static Export
content: Official Next.js documentation for static HTML export, used to configure the website for static site generation without requiring a Node.js server. This enables deployment on CDN platforms like Vercel, Netlify, or Cloudflare Pages.

title: Next.js i18n Limitations with Static Export
content: Next.js documentation explaining that the i18n configuration is not supported when using static export (output: 'export'). This limitation led to the refactoring from next-i18next server-side approach to client-side react-i18next implementation.

title: react-i18next Documentation
content: Official react-i18next documentation for client-side internationalization in React applications. Used to implement language detection, translation management, and locale switching without server-side routing.

title: i18next-browser-languagedetector
content: Browser language detection plugin for i18next, used to automatically detect user's preferred language from browser settings and localStorage. Enables seamless language preference persistence across sessions.

title: Tailwind CSS Documentation
content: Official Tailwind CSS documentation for utility-first CSS framework configuration, responsive design breakpoints, and dark mode support. Used throughout the website for rapid styling and optimal bundle size.

title: React Icons Library
content: React Icons library providing popular icon sets (FontAwesome, Material Design, etc.) as React components. Used extensively in Header, Footer, HeroSection, and FeaturesSection components for visual enhancement.

title: WCAG 2.1 Accessibility Guidelines
content: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines Level AA compliance requirements referenced in implementation of semantic HTML, ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and focus indicators throughout all components.

title: PRD - Product Requirements Document
content: The Product Requirements Document for the NextAI Translator website project, which defined the functional requirements (REQ-1 to REQ-8), user stories, and success criteria that guided the implementation.

title: Tech Design - Technical Specification
content: The Technical Design specification that defined the technology stack, architecture decisions (Next.js, Tailwind CSS, i18n), and implementation phases for the website. The specification recommended next-i18next but static export requirements necessitated refactoring to client-side react-i18next.

title: UI Components Design System Knowledge
content: Internal knowledge base article about the project's UI component patterns, BaseUI design system, and theming approach. Referenced to maintain consistency between main application and marketing website (e.g., icon library choice, responsive design patterns).

title: Build Configuration Knowledge
content: Internal knowledge base article about the project's build configuration strategy, Vite setup, and deployment pipelines. Referenced for understanding the existing project's dependency management with pnpm and ensuring consistency.

title: GitHub Openai-Translator Repository
content: The main GitHub repository for the openai-translator project, referenced throughout the website for download links, issue reporting, and community engagement.

title: Navigator API - Platform Detection
content: MDN documentation for the Navigator API (userAgent, platform) used to implement platform auto-detection in the DownloadSection component for highlighting the recommended download option.

title: Open Graph Protocol
content: Open Graph protocol specification for social media meta tags, implemented in the Layout component to control how links appear when shared on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.

title: TypeScript Configuration Reference
content: Official TypeScript compiler options reference used to configure strict type checking, path aliases (@/* imports), and JSX support for the Next.js project.

title: Next.js Image Optimization
content: Next.js Image component documentation for automatic image optimization. Set to 'unoptimized: true' for static export compatibility but can be used with external image optimization services if needed.

title: OpenAI Platform Documentation
content: OpenAI API platform documentation referenced in the documentation page for users to create API keys and configure the NextAI Translator application.

title: Anthropic Claude Console
content: Anthropic Claude API console documentation referenced in the documentation page for Claude API key generation and configuration instructions.

title: Ollama Local AI Platform
content: Ollama documentation for running local AI models, referenced in the documentation page as a privacy-focused alternative to cloud-based AI providers.

title: Chrome Web Store
content: Chrome Web Store platform referenced in download links for the Chrome extension distribution.

title: Firefox Add-ons Platform
content: Mozilla Firefox Add-ons platform referenced in download links for the Firefox extension distribution.

content: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0 referenced in the About and Terms pages, explaining the open-source license under which NextAI Translator is distributed.
